intro: Centaurea barcinonensis f. latisecta, commonly known as the broad-leaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are broad and lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
